summary: Email correspondence between federal prosecutor Katherine W. Ezell and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein case, discussing a draft letter to the Florida Bar, the Non-Prosecution Agreement, sending unredacted documents to Amy, and a meeting with victims.

persons.name: Katherine W. Ezell
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email, coordinating with other legal professionals on Epstein case matters including a letter to the Florida Bar and victim meetings.

persons.name: Mercedes C. Estrada
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding Epstein case items, suggesting involvement in the legal proceedings.

persons.name: Bob
persons.context: Mentioned as having received and forwarded a voice message, and being aware of communications with Roy Black and Tien.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Bob has not heard from, indicating potential involvement in the Epstein case legal matters.

persons.name: Tien
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Roy Black as someone Bob has not heard from, suggesting involvement in the case.

persons.name: Amy
persons.context: Recipient of unredacted documents being sent by Federal Express, indicating a role in the legal process.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Sending unredacted documents requested by Amy via Federal Express.

connections.description: Colleagues communicating about case matters, with Bob forwarding messages to Ezell.
Both copied on the email regarding Epstein case coordination.
Bob has not heard from Roy Black, indicating some expected communication regarding the case.
Special Agent is sending requested documents to Amy.

events.title: Meeting with Victims
events.description: Katherine Ezell and others are meeting with victims, as referenced in the email.

events.title: Travel Plans
events.description: Ezell mentions 'we are actually going Friday', indicating travel or a meeting.

keyFacts: The email references a 'Non-Prosecution Agreement and Addendum' related to the Epstein case.
Unredacted documents are being sent via Federal Express to Katherine Ezell for Amy.
A draft letter to the Florida Bar regarding an ethics opinion is under review.
A Victim Notification Log is being prepared by the Assistant U.S. Attorney.
Meetings with victims are scheduled, indicating ongoing victim coordination.
